caption.p: Close-up view of ( a) complete naticid drillhole and ( b) incomplete naticid drillhole. ( c) Apertural (left) and abapertural (right) views of a specimen of Falsilunatia from the La Meseta Formation (LMF), Seymour Island, Antarctica. ( d) Stratigraphic framework of the LMF. ( e) Frequency of cannibalistic attacks before and after the Eocene cooling event. ( f) Size distribution of Falsilunatia before and after the Eocene cooling event. BC, before climatic cooling; AC, after climatic cooling.
